TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit FilterEventArgs extends System.EventArgs

Docs.summary: Provides information and event data that is associated with the event.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example shows how to set an event handler for the <xref:System.Windows.Data.CollectionViewSource.Filter?displayProperty=nameWithType> event. In this example, `listingDataView` is an instance of <xref:System.Windows.Data.CollectionViewSource>.
[!code-csharp[DataBindingLab#10](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/DataBindingLab/CSharp/MainWindow.xaml.cs#10)] [!code-vb[DataBindingLab#10](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/DataBindingLab/VisualBasic/MainWindow.xaml.vb#10)]
The following example shows the implementation of the example `ShowOnlyBargainsFilter` filter event handler. This event handler uses the <xref:System.Windows.Data.FilterEventArgs.Accepted%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property to filter out `AuctionItem` objects that have a `CurrentPrice` of $25.00 or greater.
[!code-csharp[DataBindingLab#5](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/DataBindingLab/CSharp/MainWindow.xaml.cs#5)] [!code-vb[DataBindingLab#5](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/DataBindingLab/VisualBasic/MainWindow.xaml.vb#5)]
For the complete example, see [Data Binding Demo](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=163703).

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool Accepted { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.Accepted : bool with get, set

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")
set: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the item passes the filter.
Docs.value: if the item passes the filter; otherwise, . The default is .

Docs.summary: Gets the object that the filter should test.
Docs.value: The object that the filter should test. The default is .
